menu.header: Create Token Ring Sprite Sheet & JSON

kofi.title: Support me on Ko-fi
kofi.tooltip: Donate to me to get rid of this!

quality.label: Ring Quality
quality.tooltip: Quality of the generated Webp, recommend 80%

thickness.label: Ring Thickness
thickness.tooltip: How thick is the ring from the interior to the outside of the ring as a value from 0 to 1, 1 being 100%

inner.label: Inner Edge
inner.tooltip: Where on the ring should the coloration start as a value from 0 to 1, 1 being 100% distance from the center

outer.label: Outer Edge
outer.tooltip: Where on the ring should the coloration end as a value from 0 to 1.5, 1 being 100% distance from the center

color.label: Color
color.tooltip: Enter Color Hex value that is the 'white' when the ring is recolored (IE if you do a blue color the blue will be recolored the most)

error.upload-both: Please upload both images to create a ring

failed-to-download.image: Failed to download or convert image:

error.does-not-exist: SETT: Custom Ring doesn't exist, please actually create one

enabled.name: Custom Ring Enabled
enabled.hint: Enables custom ring to the Dynamic Ring Picker, note you must reload every time you change a property in order for it to update

kofi-code.name: Code from Kofi
kofi-code.hint: If you donate any amount ever to my kofi you can remove the header icon and messages from the Custom Ring Maker

notifications.ring-list-saved: Your Dynamic Ring List has been updated, reload to see the new rings

first-time-user.content:
Welcome to SETT

Hi, welcome to the module.

To access new token rings, click Configure Settings and navigate to the SETT module settings. Enable some of the rings there, save changes, and you'll be prompted to reload Foundry. After doing so, open settings again and find the Core -> Dynamic Token Ring dropdown setting, which will now include the extra rings. Select one of them, save changes, and reload Foundry once more.

1.title: Navigate To
1.content: After opening settings first navigate from into 'Core' settings

2.title: SETT Menu
2.content: You should see the SETT button that has been inserted, use this to enable new rings!

3.title: After that
3.content: After you have enabled rings make sure to click save, then you'll be prompted to reload foundry

4.title: Selecting a Ring
4.content: Select a Ring here, it will prompt you to reload so that it can update the rings

5.title: Thanks
5.content: Thanks for taking the tour, make sure to tip your tour guide (me) and your servers (Ring Makers) on you way out if you feel so inclined :P.
